title: Celebrity X Factor viewers left cringing at Love Islanders' 'tone deaf' singing
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Click to play Tap to play

Get the biggest Daily Love Island stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Love Island stars Wes Nelson, Zara McDermott, Samira Mighty and Eyal Booker certainly made an impression on X Factor : Celebrity viewers - shame it wasn't a good one, according to fans.

Tonight, the quartet appeared as a Love Island 'supergroup' as they hoped to impress judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger in LA.

The four stars, who appeared on 2018 series of the hit ITV2 show, confidently took to the stage as they attempted to wow with their vocals.

Louis was impressed, dubbing it "really good" and said that they had good chemistry.

(Image: ITV)

Meanwhile Simon said: "I think for a first audition, bearing in mind where you came from, it was a good performance but it's finding your distinct sound."

He added: "You can all sing!"

"Yeah, and they look great," Louis quipped.

(Image: ITV)

"Part of it is seeing whether people would be interested in seeing you develop," Simon continued.

Nicole insisted: "There's potential."

However viewers had a very different opinion and flocked to Twitter to cringe over the performance.

One tweeted: "Oh god. Stop. Stop. Please make them stop singing. #XFactorCelebrity."

While another commented: "Out of tune! Our poor ears #XFactorCelebrity."

A third remarked: "NOPE THIS IS TOO CRINGE #XFactorCelebrity."

"Lord i might die from cringing so hard #XFactorCelebrity," another commented.

However some enjoyed their performance.

A fan commented: "Surprised by the Love Island lot they're alright stilllll #XFactorCelebrity."

While another remarked: "Loving the celeb xfactor! Suprised at how well the love island group is!! #XFactorCelebrity."

A third tweeted: "These Love Island celebrities killed it. They were very good! #XFactorCelebrity."

*The X Factor: Celebrity returns tomorrow on ITV
description: The Love Island supergroup failed to impress X Factor viewers tonight - instead leaving them cringing into their sofas
